full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 162 of 197 2703 LCHCmax5 1 THE COURT: Look, is there a basis for the government not to admit the testimony? 2 MR. EVERDELL: Well, I think, your Honor, it's -- one moment, your Honor. 3 Your Honor, the government, as we discussed, provided that last week to us. So it's new information for us that we had to respond to. She was never shown these documents. And it was during the deposition. I mean, she was never shown the registry records of the property records. If you own houses and there is already evidence -- 10 THE COURT: I don't know. 11 MR. EVERDELL: I don't know either, your Honor, but I imagine if you own several places over the years, as Ms. Maxwell has, there is evidence in the record that she was living in different places over different years, many different places. You might not recall right off the top of your head the exact years that you lived at some address unless you can refresh your recollection. And it's also possible that if you're being asked a vague question in a deposition and you had two different addresses in London, you may assume they're talking about one and not the other, and you may answer the years you lived in the other address instead of the one we're actually talking about today. 23 THE COURT: If we get a stip on the two addresses, the two property records coming in and the depo coming in, then I 24 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00016891
